titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to Gloria W. Heath Papers, 1941-2012 CA.MS.00304
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jeanne Lowrey.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-11-08 15:20:34 -0500.

change.item: This resource was modified by the ArchivesSpace Preprocessor developed by the Harvard Library (https://github.com/harvard-library/archivesspace-preprocessor)

did.abstract: Contains biographical information, correspondence, professional files, and publications of Gloria W. Heath, Class of 1943.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Gloria Whitton Heath graduated from Smith College in 1943, majoring in Education. During the spring of 1941, Heath fell in love with flying, motivating her along with 14 other students to pool their money together to buy a plane, christened the "Bird of Paradise" and painted with the four class colors. The group took lessons and Heath obtained her private pilot's license. During World War II, Heath flew with the Women Airforce Service Pilots (WASPs), the first group of American women to fly military aircraft, earning the rank of second lieutenant. After the war, Heath became an expert in the field of search and rescue. She worked in the insurance field, founded the Flight Safety Foundation, and consulted with NASA.

Heath has earned several awards. She was given the Laura Tabor Barbour Air Safety Award in 1965 and received the Smith College Medal in 1971. In 2009, was among the 300 women WASPs to receive the Congressional Gold Medal, the highest civilian award given by Congress, by President Barack Obama and the United States Congress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials document Heath's career in aerospace, her work as a WASP during World War II, and her connection to Smith College.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into six series:

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that she owns copyright, Gloria W. Heath has assigned the copyright in her works to Smith College; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Gloria W. Heath, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Gloria W. Heath papers, College Archives, CA-MS-00304, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The papers were donated to the Smith College Archives by Gloria W. Heath.
